column4: Where on earth did synoptic disappear to, and why can't I find it in 12.04?
you can install it if you don't have it
are you telling me synoptic's no longer shipping with ubuntu distros?
I don't know.  If you don't have it on a default install, then I suppose not.  It would be duplicating functionality provided by ubuntu software center anyway I imagine
I suppose the redundancy is a fair point, but I do miss it.
sudo apt-get install synaptic :)
do you know the terminal command for enabling universe offhand?
edit /etc/apt/sources.list in your favorite text editor
package 'synaptic' has no installation candidate
updated sources n everything. also ran apt-get update. no dice.
run « sudo apt-get update » after enabling universe in /etc/apt/sources.list
probably added incorrect sources.
pastebin /etc/apt/sources.list if you want
will do. found a dated documentation page, i think it's inaccurate.
http://www.pastebin.com/aYJihZhY
last two lines were ones i added.
that's correct.  Now sudo apt-get update && apt-cache policy synaptic
there we go. What was that after the ampersand?
apt-cache policy just gives info about a package -- it didn't actually /do/ anything
it did actually update the packages as o-
I now realize I hadn't been connected to the web. Damn liveCDs.
Whoops!
